me.elrod.pureio

Class PureIOT<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.elrod.pureio.PureIOT<A>

  • public abstract class PureIOT<A>
extends java.lang.Object
    PureIOT takes the same approach to trampolining as Trampoline except it is specialized to TerminalOperation because Java doesn't give us the ability to abstract over type constructors. So, much of this is like a huge copypaste mix of PureIO and Trampoline into one mess of a structure. The end result, however, is a trampolining free IO monad, which might work. Where Trampoline is Codensity (Free Identity), and PureIO is Free TerminalOperation, PureIOT is Codensity (Free TerminalOperation). Right now, it lacks a run() method.
